visual_content: Yellow banner displaying "Special 10% Discount Available!". Below it, a green-bordered promotional card featuring the "ChargeHub" logo, text "SAVE 20% OFF YOUR FIRST CHARGE" (valid for new users, limited time offer), an image of a silver EV charging at a station, a promo code "EVSTART20" with a "COPY CODE" button, and a small URL "chargehub.com/promo".
anomalies: There is a discrepancy between the "Special 10% Discount Available!" banner (10%) and the "SAVE 20% OFF YOUR FIRST CHARGE" on the promotional card (20%). While not a severe cyberattack indicator on its own, inconsistent messaging in discounts can be a minor red flag for a potentially manipulated UI or a deceptive practice aiming to confuse users. The image appears realistic, and the brand is stated.

visual_content: The promotion area displays a stylized yellow/orange icon resembling a ticket or coupon, centered within a grey dashed-line box. Below the icon, the text 'No Active Promotions' is clearly visible.
anomalies: None. The content explicitly states 'No Active Promotions', and the graphic is a generic placeholder icon, not suggesting any specific promotion or suspicious activity.

visual_content: A graphic with a dark background promoting 'ElectroCharge'. It features text 'UNLOCK HUGE SAVINGS' and a prominent 'GET 30% OFF ALL CHARGES THIS MONTH'. It also mentions 'Limited time offer for ElectroCharge members.' and displays 'CHARGE30' with an 'APPLY NOW' button. An image of a silver EV car next to a charging station is also present. Notably, the banner above the graphic states 'Special 10% Discount Available!'.
anomalies: There is a significant inconsistency between the 'Special 10% Discount Available!' banner at the top of the kiosk section and the 'GET 30% OFF ALL CHARGES THIS MONTH' advertised within the promotion graphic. This discrepancy is a major red flag for a potentially misleading offer or scam. A 30% discount is unusually high for a general 'all charges' offer, which could be an unrealistic discount used to entice users. The 'APPLY NOW' button could lead to a phishing page designed to steal user credentials or payment information.

visual_content: A teal-colored graphic promoting '10% OFF DISCOUNT ON CHARGING' with a stylized charging station icon. A yellow banner above reads 'Special 10% Discount Available!'.
anomalies: None. The discount percentage is realistic, and the promotion is directly related to charging services within the current interface without directing users elsewhere.

visual_content: A promotional banner for 'ElectroCharge' featuring a modern silver EV (likely an SUV or crossover) charging at a station. Text states 'UNLOCK HUGE SAVINGS GET 30% OFF ALL CHARGES THIS MONTH. Limited-time offer for ElectroCharge members.' A coupon code 'CHARGE30' with an 'APPLY NOW' button is visible. The ElectroCharge logo is prominent. There is some small, blurry, unreadable text at the bottom.
anomalies: The '30% OFF ALL CHARGES THIS MONTH' is a very high discount, potentially unrealistic and used as bait in phishing schemes. The blurry, unreadable text at the bottom of the ad is suspicious as it could hide malicious URLs or disclaimers.

visual_content: A promotional banner for 'ChargeHub' offering 'SAVE 20% OFF YOUR FIRST CHARGE' for new users. It features an image of a white electric vehicle charging at a station. A coupon code 'EVSTART20' is displayed with a 'COPY CODE' button and a barcode graphic. A URL 'chargerhub.com/promos' is visible at the bottom.
anomalies: The banner itself promotes 'SAVE 20% OFF YOUR FIRST CHARGE', which contradicts the 'Special 10% Discount Available!' text displayed directly above the banner on the Kiosk interface. This inconsistency in discount percentages (20% vs. 10%) is suspicious and could indicate a misleading offer or an attempt to confuse the user.
